message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyze the relationship between carbon emissions and economic development using the World Development Indicators (WDI) dataset along with complementary datasets on renewable energy use and technology adoption.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators (WDI)", "complementary datasets on renewable energy use and technology adoption"], "topic": ["Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This research is based on a unique dataset of 100,000 job postings scraped from various online platforms in India supplemented by data from the Labour Bureau and Census of India.", "dataset": ["100,000 job postings scraped from various online platforms", "Labour Bureau", "Census of India"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Our study employs data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) to investigate the determinants of child malnutrition in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS)"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "Using panel data from the World Bank Enterprise Survey and Afrobarometer, we analyze the effect of government bureaucracy on private sector development and citizen trust in Africa.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey", "Afrobarometer"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we use data from the International Energy Agency (IEA) and Global Power Plant Database (GPPD) to examine the impact of renewable energy policies on investment in solar and wind power plants worldwide.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency (IEA)", "Global Power Plant Database (GPPD)"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Through an analysis of satellite imagery and ground-based measurements, our study assesses the impact of drought on crop yield in Ethiopia using data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) and the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO).", "dataset": ["National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)", "Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the World Bank's Doing Business report and Enterprise Surveys to investigate the relationship between regulatory quality, firm productivity, and export performance in emerging economies.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Doing Business report", "Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Our research applies a combination of household survey data from the World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS) and macroeconomic data from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to analyze the impact of inflation on income distribution in Southeast Asia.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS)", "International Monetary Fund (IMF)"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using cross-country data compiled by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the World Bank, we examine the relationship between healthcare expenditure and health outcomes in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization (WHO)", "World Bank"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "Our study employs a combination of administrative data from the Social Security Administration (SSA) and the American Community Survey (ACS) to evaluate the effectiveness of job training programs for low-income workers in the United States.", "dataset": ["Social Security Administration (SSA)", "American Community Survey (ACS)"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We investigate the impact of social safety net programs on poverty reduction using micro-level household survey data from the World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS) and administrative data on program beneficiaries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS)", "administrative data on program beneficiaries"], "topic": ["Social Protection"]}]
